items.title: Spear fisher accused of killing protected blue groper on NSW Central Coast
items.summary: Investigations are underway into the death of the near-threatened species on the NSW Central Coast, prompting calls for better awareness about local marine life.

items.title: Elderly woman allegedly assaulted in 'unprovoked and isolated' incident at South Plympton
items.summary: Police say members of the public helped the 84-year-old woman after the alleged attack before she was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

items.title: New details of ADF sexual violence probe revealed
items.summary: Minister Matt Keogh is addressing the National Press Club a year after the government responded to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

items.title: Victoria's first summer Japanese encephalitis virus detection at Horsham in state's west
items.summary: The first detection of Japanese encephalitis virus for the summer has been made in a rural Victorian city.

items.title: Papua New Guinea calls for 'buffer zone' with Indonesia amid concerns over West Papua conflict
items.summary: Australia, Papua New Guinea and Indonesia have started holding annual defence ministers meetings to build trust and boost military cooperation, while PNG proposes building a 10km-wide demilitarised "buffer zone" along its border with Indonesia.

items.title: Perth Bears sign halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for 2027 NRL season
items.summary: The NRL's Perth expansion team secures the signature of former Bulldogs halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for their inaugural season in 2027.

items.title: Experts unsure why sea snake deaths are increasing at Shark Bay World Heritage site
items.summary: Locals and marine life experts raise concern over an increased amount of reptiles washing up on WA's north-west shores, with reports of stranded sea snakes and turtles being spotted on beaches.

items.title: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery
items.summary: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

items.title: Man charged with murder after Far North Queensland stabbing

items.title: Farmer killed fighting West River bushfire near Ravensthorpe on WA's south coast
items.summary: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

items.title: South Coast fishermen charged over alleged deliberate scuttling of trawler
items.summary: Two Ulladulla fishermen have been charged under federal sea-dumping laws over the alleged deliberate sinking of an unseaworthy trawler.

items.title: Western Bulldogs former number one AFLW pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner wants to join North Melbourne
items.summary: The Kangaroos' domination of the AFLW is set to be given another boost, with a former number one draft pick confirming she wants to head to North.

items.title: Statistically, it's impossible to predict domestic violence homicide. That doesn't mean we should give up
items.summary: Victims must always be believed. The uncomfortable truth, however, is that statistically, it is almost impossible to predict lethal family violence because it is so rare.

items.title: How Wiradjuri constellations like the Great Celestial Emu make us look at the sky in a different way
items.summary: All 88 internationally recognised constellations have European origins. But First Nations astronomy tells older, beautiful stories that contain invaluable lessons and knowledge.

items.summary: Joe Montemurro echoes the words of former Matildas boss Alen Stajcic in offering a frank review of the culture surrounding the world game in Australia.

items.title: Scathing 'jobs for mates' review finds government appointments too often look like 'nepotism'
items.summary: A report into government appointments to boards savages the system, which it says too often allows governments to award friends or pick candidates for political purposes, eroding trust with the public.

items.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
items.summary: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

items.title: White House says Hegseth authorised admiral to strike alleged drug boat

items.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
items.summary: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

items.summary: The veterans' affairs minister says Defence personnel who commit sexual violence will have their convictions recorded on their national criminal history check.

items.title: Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws under National AI Plan

items.summary: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

items.summary: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

items.title: Tumbling Bitcoin's last useful business — money laundering — under threat from Tether

items.title: Is social media masking bushwalking dangers and leading to poor hiking decisions?
items.summary: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

items.title: Maps reveal the Ukraine regions Vladimir Putin does not hold, but wants anyway
items.summary: Donald Trump is expected to send his special envoy Steven Witkoff to Moscow this week to talk about a revised proposal for peace in Ukraine. There are five regions central to negotiations and Vladimir Putin wants them all.

items.title: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to push new developments
items.summary: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

items.summary: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

items.summary: Tulip Siddiq says the decision should be treated with "contempt", while her political party says she was not afforded due process.

items.title: Think tank says an overlooked solution to Australia's housing crisis could unlock about 1 million new homes
items.summary: The public policy think tank, CEDA, believes Australia could increase its current housing stock by nine per cent if just one in four standalone homes in the five biggest cities are developed into dual occupancies.

items.title: WACA seeks total exemption from paying council rates until 2035, costing up to $2.5 million
items.summary: The Western Australian Cricket Association has asked the City of Perth for a 10-year exemption from paying any rates. If granted it would potentially cost the city $2.5 million in revenue.

items.title: Inquest hears man likely experiencing psychosis was carrying fake gun and planning 'suicide by cop'
items.summary: An inquest into a 2024 police shooting in Nowra on the NSW South Coast hears police gunned down a man who was carrying a fake gun with the intention of being killed.

items.summary: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

items.title: Hayden Carl Skinner faces judge-alone trial for alleged aged care sexual assault in Coffs Harbour
items.summary: A 76-year-old woman who reported a sexual assault in a break-in at her nursing home has since died of unrelated causes as the trial of the man accused, Hayden Carl Skinner, began today in Coffs Harbour.

items.title: Businesses using 'branded identifiers' in SMS messages now need to register them
items.summary: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

items.summary: US President Donald Trump says Venezuela's airspace should be considered closed. According to international law, it's not that simple.

items.summary: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

items.summary: As approvals for multi-billion-dollar projects land on agendas at country local government meetings, staff and elected representatives battle to ensure their communities are prepared to benefit.
